entry.content:
The Untapped Potential of Autism at Work

The following content was presented at the Sydney Workability Expo 2025 on 8th August 2025.

  • Australian Bureau of Statistics (ABS) (2024) Autism in Australia, 2022: Key findings in plain language. Canberra: ABS.
  • Australian Bureau of Statistics (ABS) (2025) Labour Force, Australia: June 2025. Canberra: ABS.
  • Financial Times (2024) 'UK employers eye competitive advantage in hiring neurodivergent workers', Financial Times, 18 October.
  • Buescher, A., Cidav, Z., Knapp, M. & Mandell, D. (2014) 'Costs of Autism Spectrum Disorders in the United Kingdom and the United States', JAMA Pediatrics, 168(8), pp. 721–728. DOI: 10.1001/jamapediatrics.2014.210.
  • Hull, L., Petrides, K., Allison, C., Smith, P., Baron-Cohen, S., Lai, M. & Mandy, W. (2017) '"Putting on My Best Normal": Social camouflaging in Autistic adults', Journal of Autism and Developmental Disorders, 47(8), pp. 2519–2534. DOI: 10.1007/s10803-017-3166-5.
  • Lai, M., Lombardo, M., Ruigrok, A., Chakrabarti, B., Auyeung, B. & Bullmore, E.T. (2017) 'Quantifying and exploring camouflaging in men and women with autism', Autism, 21(6), 690-702. DOI: 10.1177/1362361316671012.
  • Hull, L., Mandy, W., Lai, M., Baron-Cohen, S., Allison, C., Smith, P. & Petrides, K. (2020) 'Development and Validation of the Camouflaging Autistic Traits Questionnaire (CAT-Q)', Autism Dev Disord, 49, 819-833. DOI: 10.1007/s10803-018-3792-6.
  • Cassidy, S., Gould, K., Townsend, E., Pelton, M., Robertson, A. & Rodgers, J. (2020) 'Is Camouflaging Autistic Traits Associated with Suicidal Thoughts and Behaviours? Expanding the Interpersonal Psychological Theory of Suicide in an Undergraduate Student Sample', Journal of Autism and Developmental Disorders, 50(10), 3638–3648. DOI: 10.1007/s10803-019-04323-3.
  • Milton D. (2012) 'On the ontological status of autism: the "double empathy problem"', Disability & Society, 27(6), 883–887. DOI: 10.1080/09687599.2012.710008.
  • Schmidt, F. & Hunter, J. (1998) 'The validity and utility of selection methods in personnel psychology: practical and theoretical implications of 85 years of research findings', Psychological Bulletin, 124(2), 262–274. DOI: 10.1037/0033-2909.124.2.262.
  • Hogan, H., Hogan, R. & Kaiser, R. (2009) 'Management derailment: Personality assessment and mitigation', American Psychological Association Handbook of Industrial and Organizational Psychology, 3, 555-575 ResearchGate.
  • Gallup (2015) 'State of the American Manager'. (Key statistic quoted in Moscatello, C. (2015) 'There's a good chance your boss should not be a boss', Glamour). → Cites Gallup [Paywall]
  • Colella, A., DeNisi, A. and Varma, A. (1997) 'Appraising the performance of employees with disabilities: A review and model', Human Resource Management Review, 7(1), 27-54. DOI: 10.1016/S1053-4822(97)90004-8.
  • Lilley, R., Lawson, W., Hall, G. et al. (2023) '"Peas in a pod": oral-history reflections on autistic identity by late-diagnosed adults', Journal of Autism and Developmental Disorders, 53, 1146–1161. DOI: 10.1007/s10803-022-05667-z.
  • Atherton, G., Edisbury, E., Piovesan, A. & Cross, L. (2022) 'Autism Through the Ages: A Mixed Methods Approach to Understanding How Age and Age of Diagnosis Affect Quality of Life', Journal of Autism and Developmental Disorders, 52, 3639–3654. DOI: 10.1007/s10803-021-05235-x.
  • Brown, C., Newell, V., Sahin, E. & Hedley, D. (2024) 'Updated Systematic Review of Suicide in Autism: 2018–2024', Current Developmental Disorders Reports, 11, 225–256. DOI: 10.1007/s40474-024-00308-9.
  • Austin, R.D. and Pisano, G.P. (2017) 'Neurodiversity as a competitive advantage', Harvard Business Review, 95(3), 96–103. HBR.org
  • Deloitte (2020) 'Neurodiversity: The Next Frontier in Talent'. Deloitte Insights.
  • Lorenz, T. & Heinitz, K. (2014) 'Aspergers – Different, Not Less: Occupational Strengths and Job Interests of Individuals with Asperger's Syndrome’, PLoS ONE. DOI: 10.1371/journal.pone.0100358.
  • Kenny, L., Hattersley, C., Molins, B., Buckley, C., Povey, C. & Pellicano, E. (2016) 'Which terms should be used to describe autism? Perspectives from the UK autism community', Journal of Autism and Developmental Disorders, 20(4). DOI: 10.1177/1362361315588200.
  • Bury, S., Jellett, R., Spoor, J. & Hedley, D. (2020) '"It Defines Who I Am" or "It's Something I Have": What Language Do [Autistic] Australian Adults [on the Autism Spectrum] Prefer?', Journal of Autism and Developmental Disorders, 53(2), 677-687. DOI: 10.1007/s10803-020-04425-3.
  • CIPD (2022) 'Neurodiversity at Work: Guide for People Professionals'. London: Chartered Institute of Personnel and Development.
